samples.context: If someone eats healthy food, they will likely have more energy. Kate eats healthy food.
samples.question: Is Kate likely to have more energy?

samples.context: When someone gets enough sleep, they tend to be in a better mood. Jim gets enough sleep.
samples.question: Does Jim tend to be in a better mood?

samples.context: If someone studies hard for an exam, they are more likely to get a good grade. Lucy studies hard for her exams.
samples.question: Is Lucy more likely to get good grades?

samples.context: Someone who saves money regularly can afford nice things. Alex saves money regularly.
samples.question: Can Alex afford nice things?

samples.context: When someone practices an instrument frequently, they will probably improve their skills. Sara practices piano frequently.
samples.question: Will Sara probably improve her piano skills?

samples.context: If someone practices meditation regularly, they will likely become more calm and mindful. Jim practices meditation regularly.
samples.question: Will Jim likely become more calm and mindful?

samples.context: When someone gets enough sleep, they tend to have more energy during the day. Lisa gets enough sleep.
samples.question: Does Lisa tend to have more energy during the day?

samples.context: If someone takes notes while studying, they are more likely to retain the information. Mark takes notes while studying.
samples.question: Is Mark more likely to retain the information?

samples.context: Someone who drinks plenty of water every day will probably stay hydrated. John drinks plenty of water every day.
samples.question: Will John probably stay hydrated?

samples.context: If someone reads challenging books, they can expand their knowledge. Susan reads challenging books.
samples.question: Can Susan expand her knowledge?
